page.title: 08RETIRED HEADMASTER EDGMOND
page.content: 20 years ago, Mr Wase,now 85,retired as a headmaster. He bought his house in 1960, he and his wife renovated it to their liking. He told that the part of Edgmond that includes the Church, Rock Lane, Pond Lane, Provost's House and Manor Road can be considered as "The Old Edgmond", but now there are many new estates. The Church is 900 years old and it plays an active part in the community of Edgmond, Traditional Services are held and many activities are linked with it. A house in Rock Lane, which was built in 1574 was a Youth Hostel and is now a Private House. There used to be an old language in Edgmond but no one speaks it now. Other organisations include T.O.C.H., Mothers Union, Senior Social Club. There is Entertainment eg. Talks, Holiday Slides, Outings.
